TextEng: "Am I supposed to know you?"
"Nope, don't remember a thing."
"Aren't you supposed to be dead?"
"Hoping, more like."
"I do seem to recall you writing a book."
"Well, the last time I saw you you were dead."
"Yes, but who raised you?"
"No, I --- never mind."
"Not exactly, no."
"Of course I'm happy to see you!"
"To be honest, I barely remember you."
*groan* "Not you again."
"Deekin? As in that kobold bard from near Hilltop?"
Text: "디킨? 힐탑 근처에 있던 그 코볼트 음유시인?"

TextEng: "I've been trying hard to forget."
"Well, it *has* been quite a long time."
"Deekin! I haven't seen you for ages!"
"A famous kobold bard? You're kidding, right?"
"I have a copy of that book, actually."
"So has it been everything you hoped, Deekin?"
"Congratulations, Deekin. I'm happy for you."
"I hated it! What gave you the right to publish anything about me?"
Text: "싫었어! 무슨 권리로 나에 대한 걸 출판한 거야?"

TextEng: "I couldn't care less about your new book."
"I should go."
"How about we join forces?"
"I don't think this is any place for a kobold."
Text: "여긴 코볼트가 있을 곳이 아닌 것 같은데."

TextEng: "So you came here expecting to go into Undermountain? By yourself?"
Text: "그래서 언더마운틴에 들어갈 생각으로 여기 온 거야? 혼자서?"

TextEng: "What do you know about the situation here, exactly?"
Text: "정확히 여기 상황에 대해 뭘 알고 있어?"

TextEng: "You know things about Undermountain?"
"That's pretty smart."
"Is that why you're here in Waterdeep?"
"Is that one about me, as well?"
"I'm sure it will be suitably epic."
"It's about my first adventure. What's not to like?"
Text: "내 첫 모험에 대한 건데. 싫을 게 뭐가 있겠어?"

TextEng: "It was better than this book I read about the plague in Neverwinter."
"It started off good but got rushed towards the end."
Text: "처음엔 좋았는데 끝으로 갈수록 급하게 쓴 것 같더라."

TextEng: "It was a bit shorter than I expected."
"Forget it. I don't need your help."
"Sure, I could use your help. Join up with me."
"You can join me... but you do what I say, is that clear?"
Text: "합류해도 되는데... 내 말을 들어야 해, 알겠지?"

TextEng: "How could you be of help, exactly?"
